basics.name: Tobias Pfeiffer
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a full-stack engineer & leader deeply interested in agile methodologies, web technologies, software crafting and teaching. I love creating products that help people and am fascinated with the human side of software development. I create and cortribute to a variety of open source projects, engage in a multitude of community events, enjoy attending and speaking at conferences.
basics.anonymous_summary: I am a full-stack engineer & leader deeply interested in agile methodologies, web technologies, software crafting and teaching. I contribute to a variety of open source projects, engage in a multitude of community events, enjoy attending and speaking at conferences.

work.summary: Helping operations and partners deliver packages on the same day. Lead a team of 15 together with the CTO, handling the day-to-day needs of the team.
highlights: Help, mentor & guide colleagues through 1o1s, pairing sessions, pull request reviews and knowledge sharing sessions
Run retrospective and iteration meetings, continously adapting and improving processes
Architect and design features with the teams
Monitor application performance and fix performance problems
Screen and interview candidates
Gather problems and requirements to define and discuss solutions
Run integration projects with customers and other involved parties

work.summary: Helping operations and partners deliver packages on the same day.
highlights: Build and maintain applications to track shipments, plan tours and manage all required logistics data in Ruby on Rails, Elixir & Phoenix as well as JavaScript (AngularJS, React)
Identify and fix performance bottlenecks
Stepped in for the CTO during a sabbatical
Run retrospectives and others meetings

work.summary: Building great applications, helping companies blossom. Work as part of a team or team lead on customer projects small and big.
highlights: Introduced practices such as retrospectives and CI-servers
built the payment system for a big festival
Mentor juniors
Taught three introductory level web development courses at the Humboldt-University Berlin
Prepared material for an advanced level Ruby on Rails course
Built a website to show screencasts in a HTML friendly way using HTML5 and popcorn.js

work.summary: Student for the JRuby organization, working on the Shoes 4 code base improving performance, enhancing functionality and refactoring the code to achieve better readability and maintainability.

anonymous.summary: Student for the JRuby organization, working on the code base of a related project improving performance, enhancing functionality and refactoring the code to achieve better readability and maintainability.

work.summary: Working on a Spree e-commerce application.
Various jobs at the working group for Internet Technologies and Systems including working as a corrector for the lectures „Internet- and WWW-Technologies“ and „Internet Security“.

volunteer.summary: The Ruby User Group Berlin is a monthly meetup about Ruby and related technologies in Berlin. My main responsibilities are organizing venues, contacting speakers and moderating the meetings as well as communication.

anonymous.summary: The user group is a monthly meetup of people interested in a specific programming language and related topics. Each meeting consists of three presentations and a couple of lightning talks. Currently the user group attracts between 80 and 120 attendees per meeting. My main responsibilities are organizing venues, contacting speakers and moderating the meetings as well as the mailing list. Sometimes I also give presentations.

volunteer.summary: Rails Girls helps to diversify the tech community by teaching beginners how to program. I support Rails Girls Berlin by coaching at workshops and hackdays.
highlights: Since March 2013 I coach a weekly project group, the rubycorns, helping attendees grow into Juniors & beyond
Created a well received introductory presentation for the workshops
Helped Rails Girls Summer of Code 2013 with the team selection process & mentoring two Rails Girls Summer of Code teams

volunteer.summary: Benchmarking library for elixir providing extensive statistics, hooks and an extensible formatting system.
Premiere library for code coverage in Ruby. Cleaned up open PRs/issues and keep it clean and fixes released.
An easy to use GUI toolkit written in Ruby, especiall helpful for teaching programming

anonymous.summary: I've been part of an open source community for over three years now and since September 2013 I am the maintainer of the community's main project, which makes heavy use of JRuby.

volunteer.summary: I like to go to conferences, speak at them and helped organize some of them.
highlights: Speaker at Ruby On Ice 2018 & 2019, Lambdadays 2018, Polyconf 2017, Full Stack Fest 2016, Rubyconf Portugal 2016, Rubyconf 2015 & more
Member of the program committee and a track host for "Monoliths and Microservices" and "Software Craftsmanship" at GOTO Berlin 2014
Organizer JRubyConf & eurucamp 2015

education.thesis: Collaborative Learning in a Massive Open Online Course environment
Event Adapters and Correlation in Process Engines
highlights: Participated in a nine month, near full time team project developing a process engine
Participated in a fifty person Scrum project to build a Customer Relationship Management system
